line.token: * This file is part of composer/ca-bundle.
* For the full copyright and license information, please view
* the LICENSE file that was distributed with this source code.
* Returns the system CA bundle path, or a path to the bundled one
* This method was adapted from Sslurp.
* For the full copyright and license information, please see below:
* Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification,
* are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

* this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.

* LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON
* ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT
* (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS
* SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
* @param LoggerInterface $logger optional logger for information about which CA files were loaded
* @return string path to a CA bundle file or directory
// If SSL_CERT_FILE env variable points to a valid certificate/bundle, use that.
// This mimics how OpenSSL uses the SSL_CERT_FILE env variable.
// If SSL_CERT_DIR env variable points to a valid certificate/bundle, use that.
// This mimics how OpenSSL uses the SSL_CERT_FILE env variable.
// Debian, Ubuntu, Gentoo, Arch Linux (ca-certificates package)
// Default cURL CA bunde path (without --with-ca-bundle option)
* Returns the path to the bundled CA file
* In case you don't want to trust the user or the system, you can use this directly
* @return string path to a CA bundle file
'Could not create a temporary file to store the bundled CA file'
* Validates a CA file using opensl_x509_parse only if it is safe to use
* @param LoggerInterface $logger optional logger for information about which CA files were loaded
// assume the CA is valid if php is vulnerable to
'Your version of PHP, %s, is affected by CVE-2013-6420 and cannot safely perform certificate validation, we strongly suggest you upgrade.'
* Test if it is safe to use the PHP function openssl_x509_parse().
* This checks if OpenSSL extensions is vulnerable to remote code execution
* via the exploit documented as CVE-2013-6420.
// This version of PHP has the fix for CVE-2013-6420 applied.
// Windows is probably insecure in this case.
// Hard coded list of PHP distributions with the fix backported.
// Symfony Process component is missing so we assume it is unsafe at this point
// This is where things get crazy, because distros backport security
// fixes the chances are on NIX systems the fix has been applied but
// it's not possible to verify that from the PHP version.
// To verify exec a new PHP process and run the issue testcase with
// known safe input that replicates the bug.
// In the case of any exceptions just accept it is not possible to
// determine the safety of openssl_x509_parse and bail out.
'{openssl_x509_parse\(\): illegal (?:ASN1 data type for|length in) timestamp in - on line \d+}'
// This PHP has the fix backported probably by a distro security team.
'Checked CA file %s does not exist or it is not a file.'
'Checked directory %s does not exist or it is not a directory.'
'Checked file or directory %s is not readable.'
"An error occurred while trying to find certificates for pattern: %s"
